wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Getting Started section focused on the LibreOllama project. Explain the project's purpose as an AI-powered productivity suite with canvas, chat, mail, tasks, and calendar functionality. Document the architecture as a Tauri-based desktop application with React frontend and Rust backend. Include step-by-step installation instructions for development environment setup, covering Node.js, Rust, and Tauri prerequisites. Provide basic usage examples demonstrating how to run the application in development mode and build production binaries. Explain the project structure highlighting key directories like src/ for frontend code and src-tauri/ for backend Rust code. Include configuration options from tauri.conf.json and package.json scripts. Document common first-time setup issues and their solutions, such as Tauri build errors or dependency conflicts. Address platform-specific considerations for Windows, macOS, and Linux development.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the LibreOllama frontend. Describe the React-based UI architecture using TypeScript with a component hierarchy organized by features and shared UI elements. Document the use of React Router for navigation between pages like Canvas, Mail, Chat, and Dashboard. Explain the state management strategy using Zustand stores for unified task, canvas, and session state. Detail the component organization with feature-based modules in /features and reusable UI components in /components. Describe the theming system implementation using Tailwind CSS and custom theme providers. Include information on the use of React context for header and layout management. Document the integration between UI components and backend services through API hooks and service layers. Address performance optimization techniques like code splitting, memoization, and lazy loading of heavy components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Canvas
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Canvas feature, a visual collaboration workspace. Thoroughly explain its implementation details including the React-Konva rendering engine, component architecture, and state management via Zustand. Document the core interfaces such as canvas initialization, element creation, selection, and transformation. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how users create and manipulate shapes, text, and connectors. Explain relationships with other components like the toolbar, sidebar, and AI integration. Address common issues such as rendering performance with large diagrams and provide solutions like progressive rendering and spatial indexing. Cover configuration options for grid snapping, alignment guides, and export capabilities. Include performance optimization tips for handling complex diagrams and memory management.

Include error handling patterns, rate limiting considerations, and API versioning. Provide code examples demonstrating common operations like batch updates, task hierarchies, and label management. Address performance optimization techniques such as pagination, selective field retrieval, and caching strategies. Document integration with the unified task store and relationship to other task management components.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: LibreOllama

## 1. Project Introduction

LibreOllama is an open-source, locally-run, privacy-first productivity suite designed for thinking, creating, and organizing. Built with Tauri, React 19, and Rust, this cross-platform desktop application integrates AI chat, visual canvas, email management, task organization, and note-taking in a single cohesive workspace. The application prioritizes security, performance, and reliability while maintaining a strong focus on accessibility and user experience.

The core goals of LibreOllama include providing a comprehensive productivity environment that runs entirely on the user's local machine, ensuring data privacy and security. The target audience consists of knowledge workers, developers, and professionals who require advanced organizational tools with AI capabilities while maintaining control over their data.

## 2. Technical Architecture

LibreOllama follows a hybrid desktop application architecture that combines a modern React frontend with a Rust backend through the Tauri framework. This architecture enables secure system-level operations while maintaining a responsive and feature-rich user interface.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[Client Interface] --> B[React Frontend]
  B --> C[Tauri Bridge]
  C --> D[Rust Backend]
  D --> E[(SQLite Database)]
  D --> F[Google APIs]
  D --> G[Ollama/AI Services]
  B --> H[Zustand Stores]
  H --> I[Unified Task Store]
  H --> J[Canvas Store]
  H --> K[Mail Store]
  I --> C
  J --> C
  K --> C
```

The application implements a micro-frontend architecture where major features (canvas, chat, mail, tasks) are organized as independent modules within the `features` directory. Each feature maintains its own components, stores, and services while sharing common utilities and design systems.

State management is primarily handled through Zustand, with key stores including the unified task store, canvas store, and mail store. These stores provide centralized state management with persistence capabilities. The application uses React Query for data fetching and caching, particularly for external API interactions with Google services.

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- [App.tsx](src/app/App.tsx)
- [main.tsx](src/app/main.tsx)

### Core Modules
- [unifiedTaskStore.ts](src/stores/unifiedTaskStore.ts)
- [CANVAS_SYSTEM_DOCUMENTATION.md](src/features/canvas/CANVAS_SYSTEM_DOCUMENTATION.md)
- [MailStoreProvider.tsx](src/features/mail/components/MailStoreProvider.tsx)

### Configuration Approach
- [tauri.conf.json](src-tauri/tauri.conf.json)
- [package.json](package.json)
- [vite.config.ts](vite.config.ts)

### External Dependencies
- [package.json](package.json)

### Integration Points
- [googleTasksApi.ts](src/api/googleTasksApi.ts)
- [ollamaService.ts](src/services/ollamaService.ts)
- [gmailAutoSync.ts](src/services/gmailAutoSync.ts)

```mermaid
graph TD
  A[App Component] --> B[Router]
  B --> C[Dashboard]
  B --> D[Chat]
  B --> E[Mail]
  B --> F[Canvas]
  B --> G[Tasks]
  B --> H[Notes]
  B --> I[Projects]
  A --> J[ThemeProvider]
  A --> K[QueryClientProvider]
  A --> L[Sidebar]
  A --> M[CommandPalette]
  C --> N[Widget Components]
  E --> O[MailStoreProvider]
  O --> P[Mail Store]
  P --> Q[Gmail Auto Sync]
  Q --> R[Google APIs]
  F --> S[Canvas Store]
  S --> T[Canvas Services]
  G --> U[Unified Task Store]
  U --> V[Google Tasks API]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Visual Canvas System
The canvas system is a production-ready, infinite whiteboard with 15+ element types, smart connectors, and advanced drawing tools. Built with Konva.js and React-Konva, it supports professional-grade diagramming and visual thinking.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Idle
  Idle --> Selection: V key
  Idle --> Rectangle: R key
  Idle --> Circle: C key
  Idle --> Text: T key
  Idle --> Pen: P key
  Selection --> Moving: Drag elements
  Selection --> Resizing: Resize handles
  Selection --> Rotating: Rotate handle
  Moving --> Idle: Mouse up
  Resizing --> Idle: Mouse up
  Rotating --> Idle: Mouse up
  Idle --> Drawing: Pen tool active
  Drawing --> CreatingElement: Mouse up
  CreatingElement --> Idle: Element created
```

### AI Chat Integration
The AI chat feature provides a complete chat UI with multi-provider LLM integration (OpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama, etc.), conversation management, and real-time streaming responses. The system is designed to work with locally-hosted AI models through Ollama, ensuring privacy and offline capability.

### Task Management System
The unified task store implements a comprehensive task management system with Kanban board functionality, drag-and-drop reordering, and rich metadata editing. The system synchronizes with Google Tasks while maintaining local persistence.

```mermaid
erDiagram
  TASK ||--o{ TASK_LABEL : has
  TASK ||--|{ TIME_BLOCK : has
  TASK ||--|| TASK_COLUMN : belongs_to
  TASK_COLUMN ||--o{ GOOGLE_TASK_LIST : syncs_with
  TASK_LABEL ||--|| COLOR : has
  TASK ||--o{ ATTACHMENT : has
```

### Gmail Integration
The application includes near-complete Gmail integration with OAuth2 authentication, secure email access, and automatic synchronization. The mail system supports reading, composing, searching, labels, and attachments with multi-account support.

### Notes and Projects
The rich notes system uses BlockNote as its editor foundation, providing hierarchical folder organization and rich text formatting. The projects feature is in progress, aiming to provide comprehensive project organization with task association and progress tracking.
</blog>
